Class BufferedScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • java.io.BufferedReader
        • BufferedScanner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Readable
    public class BufferedScanner
extends java.io.BufferedReader
    A Buffered Input Reader class that has both the efficiency of the BufferedReader class and the rich API of the Scanner class. Has been tested many times against the Scanner class while reading many numbers or words, and BufferedScanner has greatly outperformed Scanner in terms of elapsed time every time.
    Author:
    Milind Upadhyay

    • Method Detail

      • getDelim

        public char getDelim()
        Returns the delimiter
        Returns:
        The delimiter of this scanner, or WHITESPACE_DELIM if whitespace is the only delimiter.

      • setDelim

        public void setDelim​(char delim)
        Sets the delimiter of this scanner. If not called or delim is WHITESPACE_DELIM, whitespace will be the only delimiter. This delimiter and whitespace are used as a delimiter.
        Parameters:
        delim - The delimiter to use, or WHITESPACE_DELIM to only use any whitespace for a delimiter

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Returns true if the stream has been fully read.
        Returns:
        true if the scanner has finished reading, else false

      • getException

        public java.io.IOException getException()
        Returns the last IOException encountered, or null if there is none.
        Returns:
        The last IOException encountered, or null if all reads have been successful.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Returns true if the stream can continue being read and all reads have been successful.
        Returns:
        true if the scanner can continue reading, else false

      • close

        public void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Overrides:
        close in class java.io.BufferedReader

      • read

        public int read()
        Reads the next character in the buffer.
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.BufferedReader
        Returns:
        The next character, as an int, or READ_FAILURE if an IOException occurred or isDone().

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine()
        Reads a line of text. A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), a carriage return ('\r'), a carriage return followed immediately by a line feed, or by reaching the end-of-file(EOF).
        Overrides:
        readLine in class java.io.BufferedReader
        Returns:
        A String containing the contents of the line, not including any line-termination characters, or null if the end of the stream has been reached without reading any characters or an IOException occurred.

      • readString

        public java.lang.StringBuilder readString()
        Reads the next StringBuilder in the InputStream.
        Returns:
        The next StringBuilder, containing all the characters until the next whitespace character in the InputStream, the end of the InputStream, or the occurrence of an IOException

      • readInt

        public int readInt()
        Reads the next int in the InputStream, ignoring all non-digit characters encountered except a '-' at the beginning.
        Returns:
        The next int, containing all the digits until the next whitespace character in the InputStream, the end of the InputStream, or the occurrence of an IOException.

      • readDouble

        public double readDouble()
        Reads the next double in the InputStream, ignoring all non-digit characters encountered except a '-' at the beginning and the first '.' encountered.
        Returns:
        The next double, containing all the digits until the next whitespace character in the InputStream, the end of the InputStream, or the occurrence of an IOException.

      • readInts

        public int[] readInts​(int len)
        Returns an int[] with the next len ints in the InputStream. Equivalent to setting every element in the array to be readInt.
        Terminates reading if the end of the InputStream or an IOException occurs.
        Parameters:
        len - The length of the array.
        Returns:
        An int[] of length len filled with the next ints in the InputStream.

      • readIntMat

        public int[][] readIntMat​(int m,
                          int n)
        Returns an m by n int[][] with the next ints in the InputStream. Equivalent to calling readInts for every row in the 2d array.
        Terminates reading if the end of the InputStream or an IOException occurs.
        Parameters:
        m - The number of rows in the 2d array
        n - The number of columns in the 2d array
        Returns:
        A matrix with m rows and n columns with the next m * n ints in the InputStream.

      • readDoubles

        public double[] readDoubles​(int len)
        Returns a double[] with the next len doubles in the InputStream. Equivalent to setting every element in the array to be readDouble.
        Terminates reading if the end of the InputStream or an IOException occurs.
        Parameters:
        len - The length of the array.
        Returns:
        A double[] of length len filled with the next doubles in the InputStream.

      • readDoubleMat

        public double[][] readDoubleMat​(int m,
                                int n)
        Returns a m by n double[][] with the next doubles in the InputStream. Equivalent to calling readDoubles for every row in the 2d array.
        Terminates reading if the end of the InputStream or an IOException occurs.
        Parameters:
        m - The number of rows in the 2d array
        n - The number of columns in the 2d array
        Returns:
        A matrix with m rows and n columns with the next m * n doubles in the InputStream.

      • readStrings

        public java.lang.StringBuilder[] readStrings​(int len)
        Returns a StringBuilder[] with the next len StringBuilders in the InputStream. Equivalent to setting every element in the array to be readString.
        Terminates reading if the end of the InputStream or an IOException occurs.
        Parameters:
        len - The length of the array.
        Returns:
        A StringBuilder[] of length len filled with the next StringBuilders in the InputStream.

      • readStringMat

        public java.lang.StringBuilder[][] readStringMat​(int m,
                                                 int n)
        Returns an m by n StringBuilder[][] with the next StringBuilders in the InputStream. Equivalent to calling readStrings for every row in the 2d array.
        Terminates reading if the end of the InputStream or an IOException occurs.
        Parameters:
        m - The number of rows in the 2d array
        n - The number of columns in the 2d array
        Returns:
        A matrix with m rows and n columns with the next m * n StringBuilders in the InputStream.
